Open-SP by Frog and Owl

The Open Synthetic Phonics (Open SP) curriculum

The Open Synthetic Phonics Curriculum is a Project designed by Destiny "Kyther" Woods to give primary educators a great peace of material for their phonic lessons. She tested it herself already in her classes and hopes that many others like to join and improve the Documents by adding additiional stuff to the documents from their daily work.

If you just like to use the files you can load our Images from here either as a

Zip Version or a tar.xz Version.

As a Windows user you should load the Zip Version and as a Linux/Unix user we advice you to load the tar.xz version, as it is smaller then the zip file.

How to participate

If you like to add your improvements to a document or your own document to our repository, feel free to contact us at irc://irc.freenode.net/frogandowl or add an ISSUE in the GitHub ISSUE Tracker with a contact possibility so we could contact you.

A good starting point for a participation would be to load one of our Develepment Archives from here either as a

Zip Version or a tar.xz Version.

What do I need to have installed, if I want to work with these files

If you want to help to develop and improve the curriculum, you will need to download and install the following tools next to our development files:

  • a copy of the OpenOffice Suite OpenOffice.org
  • the font Aurulent Sans
  • the font Goudy Bookletter 1911
  • the font MPH 2B Damase
  • the set of handwriting fonts by Educational Fontware, Inc., which are commercial and cost $50 for an individual. You get them here
  • materials already created, which are in the Development folder

And now have fun extending this curriculum.

To share your improvements please contact us by opening an Issue with infos how we can contact you or visit us in IRC at irc://irc.freenode.net/frogandowl

The Download List

At the moment we provide the following downloads:

The whole branch downloads:

branch for Linux, branch for Windows;

the finals as a splitted archive: Finals for Linux, Finals for Windows;

the development files as a splitted archive: Developments for Linux and Developments for Windows.

You may also clone the whole project with Git by running:

$ git clone git://github.com/FrogandOwl/Open-SP
